intro: Lobelia gaudichaudii, commonly known as the Hawaiian lobelia, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It is a member of the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its striking blue to violet flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded habitats such as forests and stream banks. It has small, narrow leaves and produces clusters of bell-shaped flowers. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
